results.title: Easy virtue
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Sir Michael Balcon, M Woolf and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Noel Coward, Hitchcock’s version of what Coward intended as a comedy was produced as a melodrama. Larita Filton, a married woman, falls in love with a young artist. When he suicides, Larita divorces her drunken husband and travels abroad. There she meets John Whittaker who knows nothing of her past. His mother finds out the truth about Larita and compells John to divorce her. Hitchock appears in this film strolling past a tennis court. It is a must see for Hitchcock film buffs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alfred Hitchcock, Sir Michael Balcon, M Woolf and Gainsborough Pictures

results.title: The Swan
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, Dore Schary and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Days after the release of “The Swan”, Grace Kelly became a real Princess by marrying Prince Rainer of Monaco. In this film, she is a Eurpoean Princess destined to marry the Crown Prince (Alec Guinness). Princess Alexandra is more interested in studying astronomy with her tutor than marriage plans, yet once she sees the Prince, it is love at first sight. Capturing his attention, let alone his affections, proves difficult, until Princess Beatrix, Alex’s mother, connives a scheme to make the Prince jealous. Co-starring Louis Jourdan, Agnes Moorehead, Jessie Royce Landis and Leo G. Carroll.

results.title: Fatal attraction
results.creator_credit: Adrian Lyne, Sherry Lansing, Stanley R. Jaffe and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Michael Douglas, Glenn Close and Anne Archer star in this gripping, if at times inconsistent thriller. A passionate week-end encounter ends Dan Gallagher’s perfect life. Alex refuses to be a woman scorned and her capacity for revenge and violence is without limit. The conclusion is unforgettably shattering as the nightmare draws to its inevitable “bloody” climax. Glenn Close gives an excellent, terrifying performance as the homicidal Alex as the film grapples with men’s subconscious fears about women.

constellations_other.name: Femme fatales to fembots
constellations_other.description: When women gain power, men get scared. You can see this in the mysterious, seductive and deadly femme fatale. Using her sexuality and intellect to manipulate, control and co-opt power, the femme fatale reflects prevailing attitudes to women.

results.title: Say a little prayer
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Richard Lowenstein, Carol Hughes and Flying Films
results.brief_description: Richard Lowenstein’s film “Say a Little Prayer” is an under-rated Australian children’s film about a child’s perspective on the world which adults can enjoy. Eleven year old Seymour is bored during the school holidays, living with his fussy guardian in Richmond. His world changes when he meets the fabulous Angie, a young woman who treats him with respect and loving attention. They begin a friendship which is initially fun until Seymour comes to understand that his friend is a heroin user, and her life not as carefree and safe as he initially believed. Lowenstein’s gift for understanding the specificicities of subculture make this a moving film about families and contemporary dislocation. Sudi de Winter is excellent as Angie and Mickey Camilleri is the shy child Seymour. Co-stars Ben Mendelsohn. Based on Robin Klein’s novel “Came back to show you I could fly” with music by Not Drowning, Waving.

results.title: The Pagemaster
results.creator_credit: Pixote Hunt, Joe Johnston, Paul Gertz, David Kirschner, Turner Pictures and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Richard is a shy boy but one day when he seeks refuge in a public library during a storm, he is suddenly transported into an incredible animated world filled with adventure and fantasy. In this world, anything is possible. The only limits are set by the imagination. Some of the greatest stories are made part of Richard’s life in the mystical world of “The Pagemaster.” Stars Macaulay Culkin as Richard Tyler, Christopher Lloyd as The Pagemaster, Ed Begley Jnr as Richard’s father and the voices of Whoopi Goldberg, Patrick Stewart, Frank Welker and Leonard Nimoy.

results.title: The Shout
results.creator_credit: Jerzy Skolimowski, Jeremy Thomas and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Alan Bates gives an eery performance in this twisted tale of mind control, primitive power and the dark side of the soul. Bates plays a tramp-like figure named Crossley who claims to have spent many years with the Australian Aboriginals learning their ancient magic and claims to have learnt the power to kill with a shout. The film is a tale by Crossley during a cricket match in an insane asylum. The story centres on Crossley’s meeting with a seemingly loving young couple, he (John Hurt) a successful composer and she (Susannah York) a dedicated nurse in a small village. Crossley seduces the wife and in the process gains an ever increasing power over the couple. With a gripping ending that will have you on the edge of your seat, this is an intriguing film which questions the definition of madness.

results.title: Don't bother to knock
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Julian Blaustein and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Don’t bother to knock features a rarely seen dark side to Marilyn Monroe’s usual performances. While babysitting in a hotel, she begins a flirtation with one of the guests (Richard Widmark). He is on the rebound after breaking up with his girlfriend (Anne Bancroft), and is willingly seduced by the babysitter. When the baby awakes and disturbs their lovemaking, Monroe becomes deranged and terrorizes both the man and child. The film gives a chilling glimpse into the mind of a homicidal personality.

results.title: A Heart in winter = Un Coeur en hiver
results.creator_credit: Claude Sautet, Philippe Carcassonne, Jean-Louis Livi, FR3, Paravision International, D.A. Films, SEDIF, Orly Films, Cinea and Film Par Film
results.brief_description: Daniel Auteil and Emmanuelle Beart (the leading actors from Manon Des Sources) star in this triangular love story which explores the darker recesses of the heart and soul; where emotion is repressed. Two longtime friends in the classical music world find their friendship is threatened when a beautiful woman enters their lives. Ravel’s music forms a striking background to the drama as one woman embarks on a journey of surrender to passion.

results.title: Frantic
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Tim Hampton, Thom Mount, Warner Bros Pictures and Mount Company
results.brief_description: Dr. Richard Walker (Harrison Ford), an American cardiologist, is plunged into an emotional nightmare when he discovers his wife has mysteriously vanished during their visit to Paris. He sets out to find her, and begins to fear the city itself as he grapples with a bewildering web of language, locale, laissez-faire cops and indifferent bureaucrats. Walker’s only chance at finding his wife alive seems to rest with a streetwise waif with underworld connections (Emmanuelle Seigner). Cast also includes Betty buckley, JHohn Mahoney, Jimmie Ray Weeks, David Huddleston.

results.title: Captain Horatio Hornblower
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Raoul Walsh and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: C.S. Forester’s Napoleonic era naval hero, Captain Horatio Hornblower is made larger than life by an excellent performance from Gregory Peck. This is an epic film with plenty of broadside action and cannon fire as Hornblower’s man-o-war takes on the French and Caribbean pirateers. Hornblower’s sterness is eventually softened by true love in the guise of Lady Barbara Wellesley (Wellington’s sister), played by Virginia Mayo. This is an exciting, action-filled film with an eye for accurate historical detail.
